publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2361 Mike Watson: Cosmic Rough Riders—That the Parliament congratulates everyone at C Sharp Community recording studios in Castlemilk for their part in the success of local band, the Cosmic Rough Riders, whose debut album Enjoy the Melodic Sunshine has reached sales of 60,000 in the UK and, as such, qualifies for a British Phonographic Industry Silver Disc award; notes that this year the songs on recordings made at C Sharp have been heard by the band’s audiences during their tours of the UK, the USA, Europe and Japan, and commends the work of community-based studios like this which is evidence that the grass-roots music industry is thriving across Scotland. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S1M-2361 Cosmic Rough Riders (lodged on 25 October 2001) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2361 Cosmic Rough Riders (lodged on 25 October 2001) Mr Jamie Stone*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-2361 Cosmic Rough Riders (lodged on 25 October 2001) Marilyn Livingstone*
S1M-2361 Cosmic Rough Riders (lodged on 25 October 2001) Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S1M-2361 Cosmic Rough Riders (lodged on 25 October 2001) Cathy Peattie*
S1M-2361 Cosmic Rough Riders (lodged on 25 October 2001) Hugh Henry*
S1M-2361 Cosmic Rough Riders (lodged on 25 October 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-2361 Cosmic Rough Riders (lodged on 25 October 2001) Robert Brown*
